p.1: A stealth mode life science start-up company aiming to prevent human diseases through the power of emerging technologies. To reach that goal, the company is developing a cancer prevention platform.
p.4: Reporting to the Head of Bioinformatics, the Scientist will make an intellectual contribution to our development of a drug discovery pipeline that will be used for in-silico target identification and validation for different cancer types mainly based on the results of differential analysis of proteomics data, along with the scientific literature review and using public target, drug, and pathway databases. This is a unique opportunity to work side-by-side with industry experts and scientists in bioinformatics, cancer biology, and biochemistry to develop an early stage cancer prevention platform.
p.6: The ideal candidate will be a self-starter who seeks opportunities to collaborate in a start-up environment. She or he will bring experience doing data analysis, data extraction, and data quality assessment.

li: Design and implement innovative algorithms to address challenges in drug discovery, specifically based on analysis of proteomics data and PTMs
li.1: Adoption and modification of existing machine learning and AI methods and tools for analysis for target identification and validation
li.2: Data retrieval, transformation, and integration of public target and drug databases to support building an in-house drug discovery pipeline on big data
li.3: Investigate target engagement quantifiably and reliably and show the therapeutic role of target in the disease by developing algorithms and using data-driven methods
li.4: Design QC metrics for target assessment and orthogonal methods for target validation
li.5: Study potential drugs that can hit the target and evaluate the effectiveness of the drugs
li.6: Design new drugs for existing targets if repurposing is not available
li.7: Provide feedback to other teams to further improve existing pipelines and develop new workflows
li.8: Visualization and interpretation of analysis results to provide data driven conclusions

li: Experience in using machine learning, statistical analysis, and AI tools and libraries
li.1: Experience in building data analysis pipeline, problem definition, building hypothesis, and iterative model refinement
li.2: Experience structured and unstructured databases and data management tools
li.3: Experience using APIs to access and handle remote databases
li.4: Experience in drug discovery workflows, specifically therapeutic target identification, and preclinical validation
li.5: Experience in pathway analysis and networked-based methods in molecular biology
li.6: Familiarity with proteomics data specifically those acquired by mass spectrometry
li.7: Familiarity with Linux, shell, scripting languages, one popular programming language, preferably Python, C, or Java
